intro: Epilobium neutrum, commonly known as the common willowherb, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Onagraceae family. It is characterized by its erect, often branched stems and lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The flowers are usually pink or purple, with four petals and numerous stamens, forming showy clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, along roadsides, and in wetlands. This plant is an important component of various ecosystems and serves as a food source for several insect species.
